On 3/17/2024 at 4:31 PM, Spacenerd1337 said:

Hey! so my apollo command module is shiny in the parts selector but not when i put it out to build. Can someone pleas help me fix this?

Make sure you have reflections turned up in the KSP graphics settings. (I'm assuming you have Textures Unlimited already installed)

Question about the PEBKAC LES system since I couldn't find an answer in this thread: what's the difference between the regular Abort! mode and Abort Mode 1A in action groups? Presumably Abort Mode 1B is the same as the real Apollo Abort Mode 1B where the LES tower doesn't fire its pitch motor since the stack is high enough.

16 hours ago, marxman28 said:

Question about the PEBKAC LES system since I couldn't find an answer in this thread: what's the difference between the regular Abort! mode and Abort Mode 1A in action groups? Presumably Abort Mode 1B is the same as the real Apollo Abort Mode 1B where the LES tower doesn't fire its pitch motor since the stack is high enough.

I honestly have no idea. We inherited it from the PEBKAC mod back in 2016 or so and I've never really understood what it does.

19 hours ago, marxman28 said:

Question about the PEBKAC LES system since I couldn't find an answer in this thread: what's the difference between the regular Abort! mode and Abort Mode 1A in action groups? Presumably Abort Mode 1B is the same as the real Apollo Abort Mode 1B where the LES tower doesn't fire its pitch motor since the stack is high enough.

Shockingly, I think I can help here. I believe it works like this:

Standard Abort action will execute Abort1A if below 3000m altitude, otherwise it'll execute Abort1B. 1A activates both the escape and pitch engines, and 1B activates only the escape engine.

How to get a satellite into a high orbit around Frontier and don't have powerful rockets. Mix and match a Redstone with a Black Arrow and slap two Castor Booster, Does Red Arrow or Blackstone sound better?

I am sorry for the shape but while Frontier is smaller than Kerbin, its gravity and pressure is bigger and I had to reach a very high orbit.

Test to see how TUFX works.

Pictures from the mounted camera.
